plus 'penalty' for trade with RussiaThe US president said the measures would take effect from from 1 August, the US deadline for a trade deal.19 hrs agoAsiaMore than a dozen children die because of food shortages in Sudan camp - medicsFamine has been declared in areas of Darfur, an region particularly hard hit by the ongoing civil war.Olympic star Dahlmeier dead after climbing accidentTwo-time Olympic champion Laura Dahlmeier dies aged 31 after a mountaineering accident in Pakistan. India and US launch 'first-of-its-kind' satelliteNasa-Isro joint mission Nisar will record the minutest of changes in the land, sea or ice sheets.Adidas to raise prices as US tariffs costs rise by €200mThe German sportswear giant sources most of its products from Vietnam and Indonesia.Tanzania's ban on foreigners operating small businesses sparks Kenyan backlashThey are barred from areas like mobile money transfers, tour guiding, small-scale mining and curio shops.FeaturesWhy did Russian mega earthquake not cause more tsunami damage?The earthquake was one of the strongest ever recorded, but its tsunami was not as bad as feared.What does recognising a Palestinian state mean?Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer has announced that the UK will recognise a Palestinian state in September unless Israel meets certain conditions. A mistaken elevator, frantic emails and a run for help - how New York shooting unfoldedWorkers barricaded doors and sent goodbye notes as a man roamed through a skyscraper killing people. Russian soldiers scammed and robbed of war cash on return from UkraineA number of cases emerge of servicemen targeted for their salaries and pay-offs by government officials.Greece warns of 'invasion' as it halts asylum on Med routeGreek migration minister Thanos Plevris says his country faces a "state of emergency". Watch/ListenWatch: Huge stick insect discovered in AustraliaA new "supersized" species of stick insect that is roughly as heavy as a golf ball has been discovered in Australia.Watch: Major earthquake off Russia triggers widespread tsunami warningsTsunami warnings have been issued in Russia, Japan, Ecuador and Hawaii.Bowen: Plan to recognise Palestinian state a big change for British foreign policyPM Sir Keir Starmer has said the UK will recognise a Palestinian state in September unless Israel takes "substantive steps

government has announced it will recognise a Palestinian state unless Israel agrees to end the crisis.22 hrs agoMiddle EastMore than 60,000 people killed in Gaza during Israel offensive, Hamas-run health ministry saysAt least 112 people were killed in the 24 hours before late Tuesday morning, 22 while trying to get aid, the ministry says.2 days agoIsraeli rights groups accuse Israel of genocide in GazaIsrael's government rejects the allegations in the separate reports by B'Tselem and Physicians for Human Rights-Israel.3 days agoMiddle EastGaza air drops 'a grotesque distraction', aid agencies warnSeveral aid groups say dropping food from the air onto densely populated Gaza is a risk to civilian lives.4 days agoMiddle EastLammy hopes plan to recognise Palestinian state 'will get ceasefire'The government has announced it will recognise a Palestinian state unless Israel agrees to end the crisis.22 hrs agoMiddle EastUK to recognise Palestinian state unless Israel meets conditionsThe PM announces there will be a shift in policy in September, unless Israel takes steps including agreeing a ceasefire in Gaza.2 days agoPoliticsFamine 'currently playing out' in Gaza, UN-backed experts warnIt comes as aid agencies warn Israel's recent measures to increase aid supplies are not enough.2 days agoMiddle EastMore than 60,000 people killed in Gaza during Israel offensive, Hamas-run health ministry saysAt least 112 people were killed in the 24 hours before late Tuesday morning, 22 while trying to get aid, the ministry says.2 days agoAnalysisBowen: Starmer's announcement a big change for British foreign policyPM Sir Keir Starmer has said the UK will recognise a Palestinian state in September unless Israel takes "substantive steps to end the appalling situation in Gaza".Watch: How did Gaza get to the brink of starvation?The BBC's diplomatic correspondent Paul Adams explains how the people of Gaza have reached a point of starvation.Bowen: Air dropping aid is an act of desperation that won't end hunger in GazaAir drops can look good on television, but deliver very little aid and endanger civilian lives.​​What is inside the GHF food aid box being distributed in Gaza?BBC Verify examines the meals handed out to Gazans - and why their nutritional value is questioned by some experts.French pledge to recognise Palestine is a gamble - so will Starmer follow suit?The prime minister is facing pressure at home and abroad to recognise a Palestinian state.Human stories'We need a real solution': Gazans welcome aid plan but fear it will not end crisisIsrael says aid convoys will be allowed into Gaza, after weeks of mounting pressure and warnings of starvation.'I'm so tired': Mother of starving Gazan baby speaks to BBC Hedaya al-Muta'wi's 18-month-old son Mohammed suffers from malnutrition due to famine, weighing just 6kg.He went to get aid and didn't come back - stories of people killed in GazaAs aid agencies warn of "mass starvation", the BBC hears from the relatives of some of those killed in the past week. 'All the people are hungry': Voices from Gaza on desperate lack of foodAll week across the BBC we've been hearing from people in Gaza about their lives as food supplies are restricted leading to malnourishment and starvation.Church leaders return with 'broken hearts' after rare visit to GazaThe Latin and Greek Orthodox patriarchs of Jerusalem describing starving people not "batting an eyelid" at the sound of bombing.Latest updates34 mins agoDozens killed seeking food in Gaza, hospital says, as US envoy arrives in IsraelIsrael's military says fired "

mother are among the dead and Kyiv says it has seen the biggest number of child casualties of the war.4 hrs agoEuropeRussian missile hits Ukrainian training unit, killing and wounding servicemenUkraine's military says three people were killed as Russia posted video of what it said was the strike.23 hrs agoEuropeFive killed as Ukraine and Russia trade drone attacksThree people die in strikes on Dnipro in Ukraine, while two are killed in Russia's Rostov region.5 days agoEuropeSchool-leavers losing their lives for Russia in Putin's war with UkraineRussia has promised that no 18-year-olds will be sent to fight in Ukraine, but the BBC finds many have already been killed.5 days agoEuropeRussia and Ukraine trade drone attacks after latest ceasefire talksDeaths have been reported on either side of the border, just hours after a third round of ceasefire talks took place in Turkey.7 days agoEuropeRussian missile hits Ukrainian training unit, killing and wounding servicemenUkraine's military says three people were killed as Russia posted video of what it said was the strike.23 hrs agoEuropePutin must agree Ukraine ceasefire in 10 or 12 days, says TrumpThe US president says there is "no reason" for waiting amid little sign of progress towards peace.3 days agoEuropePro-Ukraine hacker group claims Aeroflot cyber-attackThe Kremlin says reports of a cyber-attack on Russia's national carrier Aeroflot are "worrying".3 days agoEuropeFive killed as Ukraine and Russia trade drone attacksThree people die in strikes on Dnipro in Ukraine, while two are killed in Russia's Rostov region.5 days agoEuropeAnalysisRussian soldiers scammed and robbed of war cash on return from UkraineA number of cases emerge of servicemen targeted for their salaries and pay-offs by government officials.Backlash grows after Zelensky strips anti-corruption bodies of independenceProtests gather pace in Ukrainian cities as some of Kyiv's closest allies sound alarm bells.Kill Russian soldiers, win points: Is Ukraine's new drone scheme gamifying war? The scheme allows Ukrainian troops to trade videos of confirmed kills on the battlefield for prizes.Rosenberg: Russia more relieved than rattled by US tariff threatThe US is threatening Moscow with financial consequences if a deal to end the Ukraine war is not reached within 50 days.Trump weapons pledge marks major step forward for UkraineFor the first time since returning to the White House, Trump pledges to make new weapons available to Ukraine.On the groundRussia's summer push in Ukraine targets three fronts but faces stern resistanceAnalysis of Russia's advance in northern and eastern Ukraine in maps.'It's Groundhog Day': Ukraine's sky defenders stuck in relentless battleUnder fire of 100 drones a night, there's little talk of a ceasefire in the front-line city of Sumy.The doctor fighting for women's health on Ukraine's front lineDr Baksheiev, a gynaecologist, travels to front-line areas in his kitted out mobile clinic.'Mariupol is diseased': Residents deny Russian claims occupied city returning to normalRussian shattered Mariupol with a months-long siege in 2022. Now, it says it's rebuilding it.After a night of terror in Kyiv, the search for dead goes onA cruise missile slammed into an ordinary residential block early on Tuesday, likely travelling at about 500mph.Q&A: Big protests, brief talks and pressure on ZelenskyUkraine saw nationwide demonstrations over controversial anti-corruption reforms.Latest updates4 hrs agoRussian strikes kill eight and hit Kyiv apartment block, officials sayA boy and his mother are among the dead and Kyiv says it has seen the biggest number of child casualties of the war.4 hrs ago23 hrs agoRussian missile hits Ukrainian training unit, killing and wounding servicemenUkraine's military sa

agoLiverpoolDouble-decker bus catches fire in central LondonThe back of the number 88 went up in flames at about 06:50 BST on Great Portland Street. 4 hrs agoLondonCrow visits vet who helped him fly agoLiverpoolBodies of man and woman found beneath cliffs at Whitby AbbeyNorth Yorkshire Police launches an investigation into the deaths near Whitby Abbey.Car crashes through doors and into community hallA car collided with another vehicle before crashing into a community centre, says the fire service.Zoo announces death of three capybarasA Birmingham zoo says the three capybaras were put to sleep due to "age-related challenges".Search continuing for person missing in seaHM Coastguard says the operation at Flamborough "remains ongoing", with police divers on scene.Cow recovering after Wiltshire river rescueFirefighters use Inflatable equipment to rescue the animal, which was trapped underground.Stories to make you smileZoo finds successors to Terry the swearing ravenTerry, who died several years ago, was notorious for swearing at visitors at Crawley's Tilgate Zoo.The chippy where the food is made from feltThe chip shop art installation goes on show at a central London gallery from 1 August.Mystery as wild otter pup turns up in flamingo enclosureThe wild otter pup is rehomed in a rescue centre after being found by staff at Colchester Zoo.Features & AnalysisBirmingham takes the Osbournes to its heartThousands lined the streets as the heavy metal legend made his final journey through his home city.'Endless battle': Fighting the crime gangs taking over the high streetPeople say they're terrified of going to the shops, with reports of intimidation and open drug dealing.'My Sheffield football friendships endure today'Lioness Esme Morgan reminisces about playing boys' football in Sheffield leagues until she was 15.Learner drivers shift to automatics for EV futureDriving instructors in Lincolnshire say more people are choosing to learn in automatic vehicles.The growing sport helping blind people track soundWarren Wilson says Showdown boosts a vital skill - and meeting other players gives him "deeper support". Vanessa Whyte and her two children has been held in Maguiresbridge.Some football fans 'determined to destroy' Linfield's reputation Linfield Football Club has been fined for sectarian songs being sung by fans.'I never saw my dad again after lockdown', Covid-19 inquiry hearsThe son of Ivor McQuitty who died in May 2020 in hospital from Covid-19 spoke at the UK Covid-10 Inquiry. Belfast man missing after disappearing from Paris airportThe last time he was known to speak to someone from home was after he missed his flight.Executive considering storm compensation lawNorthern Ireland is currently the only part of the UK which does not have such a compensation scheme.Features & AnalysisWhy has the UUP turned to another man in uniform?Jon Burrows joins Ulster Unionist assembly members which include former soldiers and a retired submarine commander.Wayne Rooney recalls 'great memories' of Super Cup NI ahead of son's matchRooney told BBC News NI he is delighted to be in Coleraine to watch his son Kai play.I expected 80s Belfast to be a 'warzone', says Fatboy SlimThe Right Here, Right Now DJ says Belfast hits all the right notes ahead of his Boucher Playing Fields gig.Ballymena United honour young fan's life with new kit designBallymena United's manager has said a young fan who died in a car crash will be honoured in their new kitFoyle & WestFootball clubs issue joint statement condemning violenceBoth clubs expressed "great regret" over the disturbances which they said "endangered the safety of genuine fans".Thousands line streets for SuperCupNI team parade SuperCupNI, now in its 42nd year, will bring together 1,200 footballers from 62 elite youth teams.House destroyed in arson attackPolice received a report of a fire on the Seacoast Road near Limavady shortly after 02:00 BST.Tour guides for deaf people 'will encourage inclusivity'Six people from the north west qualify as tour guides for the deaf community.Listen: North West TodayA round-up of local news, sport and weather across the north west of Northern Ireland.Republic of IrelandIrish firm buys Sainsbury's

newspapers in Wales.Four in court charged with arson after Ferndale fireThe court heard the fire caused £650,000 worth of damage to three houses, their contents and a vehicle.Unexploded devices removed after being found in town centreBusinesses were evacuated in Bridgend after two unexploded devices were found at a building site. medicsFamine has been declared in areas of Darfur, an region particularly hard hit by the ongoing civil war.19 hrs agoAfricaFeatures and analysis'How will we survive?' Lesotho factory that made Trump golf shirts hit hard by US tariffsThe uncertainty around the paused tariffs has led to massive layoffs in Lesotho's textile industry.How Trump wants the US to cash in on mineral-rich DR Congo's peace dealThe US president is spearheading an ambitious but controversial deal to end a long-running conflict. The would-be Congolese saint murdered 'mafia-style' for refusing bribesCongolese customs official Floribert Bwana Chui Bin Kositi has been beatified for standing up to corruption.Artist explores the toxic mining legacy of Zambia's 'black mountains'A major exhibition about the dangerous lives of the boys and young men who scour slag heaps in search of copper.Trees, tresses and teamwork: Africa's top shotsA selection of the week's best photos from across the African continent and beyond.Furious protests at move to cement Togo ruling family's grip on power after 58 yearsFaure Gnassingbé may no longer be president but he still pulls the strings - and no longer has to face elections.Oil-rich Sudanese region becomes new focus of war between army and rival forcesControl of oil-rich Kordofan is a big prize for both warring groups in their bid to take the country, analysts say.'It's a lifesaver': Making solar power affordable in South AfricaThe medical equipment keeping Mark Moodley's mother alive no longer relies on an erratic power supply.SportNigeria's victorious women footballers promised $100,000 eachReturning home as African champions, the president thanked the players for their inspiration.What we learned from Women's Africa Cup of Nations 2024After Nigeria sealed their 10th African title, several issues need to be addressed to boost women's football on the continent.Middlesbrough sign Ivorian midfielder KanteMiddlesbrough complete their second signing of the summer after agreeing a five-year deal with Abdoulaye Kante from French club Troyes.Wafcon winner will stay in my heart forever - EcheginiJennifer Echegini says her Women's Africa Cup of Nations-winning goal for Nigeria against Morocco is one she will keep in her heart forever.Nigeria seal 10th Wafcon as comeback stun
